intro: Ruminia hyemalis, commonly known as the winter ruminia, is a herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale pink, blooming in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and have a slightly serrated edge. Ruminia hyemalis is often found in moist meadows and along streambanks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
